post.body: you know.. I think I actually know you..? aren't u mindy's friend? i think you've been to my house?!
would clearly be deceptive. does that make any sense?
and only tweeting about myself or interacting on a personal level while *really* wanting to get say, an article (more)
i am clearly connecting w/ industry people here b/c of my job, but i think it's lame to only tweet about work
well, both? b/c I am both jennifer and a PR person? i think i'm pretty open about who i am, what i do
re the spam thing, i rarely mention clients or my company in my tweets. i'm here to learn and network just like everyone else
i personally am not necc looking to get tons of followers. i follow lots of media peeps, good to know what they're doing/writing
I would argue it's not that we can't grow organically, but our job requires learning and growing quickly. Where's the harm there?
So... you are complaining about PR people following too many people on twitter? seriously?
C'mon. You think all PR peeps are failed journos? Truth is many of us grew up wanting to be a flack #journchat
Agreed twitter is for convo. But so easy to un-follow if someone's running ads, what's the big deal? #journchat
I think sponsored posts are fine. As long as readers know, it's not an issue with me. #journchat
unfortunately, that's the price we pay for working for others.. bosses OR clients. most jobs require self-censorship #journchat
Right, that's fine. But some outside PR folk have been known to pose as say, the CEO of their client. Big no-no #journchat
ABSOLUTELY. transparency is crucial. PR reps should NEVER pose as anyone else.. it will come out eventually! #journchat
i think it comes down to people needing to think critically. independently. not assume all written content truth #journchat
how about we discuss holiday pitching/press release timing/writing schedules/deadlines? good/bad to go out w/ news now?
we shouldn't have to sell it, more important is we help msg product so as to convey most interesting benefit #journchat
give that guy my number
exactly. and what is better than being trendy?? heh.
ya a bit of a headache. would be worse if I hadn't medicated w/ blk tea, then a mocha, then coke. Clearly we r beyond probl
ha! great answer!!
aww. I'm glad they have company :)
yes! you should meet with pixsense! they do mobile social networking...DM me if ur interested
I guess I just wasn't meant to do the tech party circuit this winter. Just so hard to do stuff on weeknights.
K thanks again for enlightening (and lively) discussion... till next week folks #journchat
I'm not against sponsored tweets. People gotta make $ somehow. BUT- big but- there MUST be full disclosure. otherwise it's spam #journchat
I think just about everyone with a reputation and/or job on the line needs to monitor what they tweet, not just journos! #journchat
I'd participate in #journchat as long as the way sponsors were integrated wasn't too annoying #journchat
Late to the game, but here in/out nonetheless- I'm Jennifer, work in tech/telecom/web 2.0 PR #journchat
about to go play in the snow w/ the niece. no idea the last time I made a snowman or had snoball fight. must b time!
I'm gonna start a tech blog called SmooshyChew. All the other similar verbs have now been taken
OH (customer at a video game store) "which one will help me w/ chicks?"
um. there's no coffee at my parents' house. this might be interesting
Trapped at my parents' house. It's blizzarding outside. cabin fever has already set in
Hot chocolating at sis' baby shower
Helloooo suburbia!!!
just found out my bro's new job is the cook for a gay bar/lounge in seattle called 'purr'. make of that what u will.
sfo, international terminal. first virgin flight...sounds a bit redundant, no?
Totally spent. Calling it quits. One of these days I'll figure out how to plan my weeks' activities without having panicked eves like this
